channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NM
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NM

item.title: Report E-2023120275
item.description:
Report E-2023120275

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-21T18:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-27
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Associate did not block and/or brace freight properly for transport. Freight was crushed causing release of product.

item.title: Report X-2023120189
item.description:
Report X-2023120189

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-28
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on a bulk truck in wet condition. Put on hazmat gloves, placed package into a damage bin and relocated damaged hazmat to the QA cage for further investigation. DescribePack: 2 of the 4 contained bottles had loose caps which caused leakage throughout packaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was handled with hazmat gloves and taken to a QA cage to inspect further. Absorbency pads placed in the semi-damp areas, but it did not seem that there was too much release.
